title: Bodyguard confesses he helped Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie get together through filthy notes
text:

Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie used to swap "explicit" notes on the set of their first film together - while he was still married to Jennifer Aniston, a celebrity bodyguard has claimed.

Mark Behar, who worked as security for Angelina for years, previously revealed how the pair got close and flirty on the set of their 2005 film Mr And Mrs Smith.

While they both denied getting physical until after Brad split from Friends star Jen, Mark said there was an underground network of minders passing secret notes to and from the lovers while they were filming the steamy assassin movie together.

"[Angelina] and Brad were constantly laughing and flirting with each other and acting like two school kids who had the hots for each other, and it was so cute," he told Us Weekly in 2016.

(Image: Reuters)

"I caught them several times in each other’s trailers making out. I wasn't shocked at all when they got married years later."

Brad and Angelina announced their romance in late 2005, months after his split from Jennifer, and always denied they were more than friends on set.

Behar wasn't the only former bodyguard to dish the dirt on the couple after Brad and Ange announced they were separating in 2016.

Mark Billingham, who provided security for the couple and their six children for 18 months, stuck in the boot when he claimed he had practically fathered Brad's offspring.

(Image: MB Pictures/REX)

"It was clear from the start we had a great chemistry and they trusted me with the kids," he told the Sun at the time.

"We got very close, I was living with them all the time. I could take the kids anywhere I wanted to on my own. No one else was allowed to do that… I took them swimming. I fathered them, basically."

Billingham went on: "What surprised me was their low level of common sense

"I found it crazy when they would ask me questions like, 'How do I go down to that bar?' and 'What do I need to do to get there?' They're not stupid, but because of the world they live in they just haven't done something like that for so long. I found that weird."

(Image: MB Pictures/REX)

The ex-SAS soldier, who went on to become an instructor for Channel 4's SAS: Who Dares Wins, also revealed that his biggest challenge was protecting Brad, because "people love her but hate him".

"You have to figure out a way of protecting them from all that. It was challenging, but interesting," he added.

Meanwhile, Angelina has opened up on how how the last few years "have not been the easiest" for her after ending her 12-year relationship with Brad.

The 44-year-old Hollywood star told how her six children were the reason she "pulled through".

"Anyone who is a parent knows there is a strength within you that grows when you just have to survive anything to be strong enough for them and you have to pull them through anything," she said.
description: Celebrity bodyguard Mark Behar revealed how Brad and Ange would swap explicit notes through their network of minders
